channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024070525
item.description:
Report E-2024070525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Individual Not A Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 3 poly totes were received these totes were placed into the box sideways. the totes are as wide as they are long. When going to retrieve the 2nd tote the forklift operator pushed his forks in too far and forked the drum of cardinal bag that was behind the tote. In house cleanup wad used to clean up the spill. the spill was contained and managed correctly. no material went offsite. The root cause of the spill being that the totes were placed into the truck sideways this was communicated with the people who loaded the truck to not do that in future.

item.title: Report E-2024070517
item.description:
Report E-2024070517

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) pints of material released from one (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to a loose cap. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070518
item.description:
Report E-2024070518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of material released form one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to load shift that crushed the container. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the recovered material into one (1) 8-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071205
item.description:
Report X-2024071205

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11th a package was found during the sort that showed signs of leakage. The box was marked as UN1197, EXTRACTS, LIQUID, 3, II. Further investigation revealed that a glass bottle inside of the package, which was wrapped in bubble wrap had shattered, The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and an amended shippers dec was requested by the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024071162
item.description:
Report X-2024071162

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INFH location a plastic case had signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered four cans of spray paint inside with various other items. One of the cans of spray paint discharged all of it's contents inside of the case. The plastic case did not have any DG marking or paperwork. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2024070394
item.description:
Report E-2024070394

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-gallon of Coreactant F released from two (2) 1-gallon metal cans due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined a contractor should be sent out for cleanup. Set Environmental arrived onsite and deployed oil dri and cleaned up the impacted area. Set Environmental containerized the impacted metal cans, recovered material, and cut-up pallet into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums for disposal.
